Device List Service

NOTICE:

The namespace prefix http://cisco.com/jnap/ has been deprecated but is still supported. All JNAP clients should switch to the new namespace prefix http://linksys.com/jnap/.
Copyright Notice
© 2019 Belkin International, Inc. and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.

Change History

Revision Date Notes
7.0.0 2020-07-29 Added optional isHomeKitSupported parameter in Device2 structure, returned by GetDevices3
6.0.1 2020-05-26 Added DeviceList7, which includes the following:
  • New result ErrorDeviceDBFailure and optional output parameter ErrorInfo in the following actions:
    • GetLocalDevice
    • GetDevices
    • GetDevices3
  • Action ClearDeviceList2 with result ErrorDeviceDBFailure and output parameter ErrorInfo
6.0.0 2019-07-17 Added DeviceList6 service to indicate the following actions now require authentication:
  • GetLocalDevice
  • GetDevices
  • GetDevices3
5.0.1 2018-05-01 Added 2 new device types: Wearable and DeviceHub.
5.0.0 2017-05-11 Rev DeviceList5 service to indicate that ClearDeviceList is working properly in newer Nodes FW.
4.0.1 2017-03-13 Added an optional isGuest in Layer3Connection2 to indicate whether an interface is on the Guest network.
4.0.0 2017-01-03 Deprecated DeviceList3 service and GetDevices2 action.
We released Nodes RTM FW that supports these service and action, but they weren't implemented.

Added DeviceList4 service that supports Node infrastructure and interface types.

  • action GetDevices3
3.0.1 2016-06-23 Added Layer3Connection2 struct to tell which Node an interface is connected to.

Added the following:
  • struct Layer3Connection2
3.0.0 2016-06-20 Added DeviceList3 service that supports Node infrastructure and interface types.

Added the following:
  • action GetDevices2

Services

DeviceList

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/DeviceList
This service provides information about the devices that are connected to the network, as well as those that are not currently online but have been connected to the network in the past.

Service Actions

  • DeleteDevice
  • GetDevices
  • GetLocalDevice
  • SetDeviceProperties

DeviceList2

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/DeviceList2
This service provides information about the devices that are connected to the network, as well as those that are not currently online but have been connected to the network in the past.

Service Actions

  • ClearDeviceList
  • DeleteDevice
  • GetDevices
  • GetLocalDevice
  • SetDeviceProperties

DeviceList4

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/DeviceList4
Do not use DeviceList3 service and GetDevices2 action. This service provides information about the devices that are connected to the network, as well as those that are not currently online but have been connected to the network in the past.

Service Actions

  • ClearDeviceList
  • DeleteDevice
  • GetDevices
  • GetDevices3
  • GetLocalDevice
  • SetDeviceProperties

DeviceList5

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/DeviceList5
This service provides information about the devices that are connected to the network, as well as those that are not currently online but have been connected to the network in the past.

Service Actions

  • ClearDeviceList
  • DeleteDevice
  • GetDevices
  • GetDevices3
  • GetLocalDevice
  • SetDeviceProperties

DeviceList6

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/DeviceList6
This service provides information about the devices that are connected to the network, as well as those that are not currently online but have been connected to the network in the past.

Service Actions

  • ClearDeviceList
  • DeleteDevice
  • GetDevices
  • GetDevices3
  • GetLocalDevice
  • SetDeviceProperties

DeviceList7

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/DeviceList7
This service provides information about the devices that are connected to the network, as well as those that are not currently online but have been connected to the network in the past.

Service Actions

  • ClearDeviceList2
  • DeleteDevice
  • GetDevices
  • GetDevices3
  • GetLocalDevice
  • SetDeviceProperties

Actions

ClearDeviceList

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/ClearDeviceList
This action clears all of the devices from the device list.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
preserveProperties bool no If true, then each device's custom properties will be cached and re-added to the device upon rediscovery.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/ClearDeviceListResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/ClearDeviceList"

{
  "preserveProperties": true
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

ClearDeviceList2

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/ClearDeviceList2
This action clears all of the devices from the device list.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
preserveProperties bool no If true, then each device's custom properties will be cached and re-added to the device upon rediscovery.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
ErrorInfo string yes Information about an error that occured while retrieving device information. This value will exist and only if result is ErrorDeviceDBFailure.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/ClearDeviceList2Result
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorDeviceDBFailure A failure occurred while retrieving information from the device database.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/ClearDeviceList2"

{
  "preserveProperties": true
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "ErrorInfo": "Payload exceeded maximum size"
  }
}

DeleteDevice

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/DeleteDevice
This action deletes a device from the device list. This is useful for "cleaning up" after a device is permanently removed from the network (e.g., thrown away, returned to the store). Only devices that are not currently connected to the network can be deleted. Note that if a device is deleted and subsequently rejoins the network, the device ID that is assigned to it when it is rediscovered will not necessarily be the same device ID that it had before it was deleted.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
deviceID UUID no The unique ID of the device that should be deleted.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/DeleteDeviceResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorCannotDeleteDevice The device cannot be deleted because it is currently connected to the network, or it is the device that hosts the device list service.
ErrorUnknownDevice The specified device ID does not match any known device.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/DeleteDevice"

{
  "deviceID": "c23de4d6-15d0-40bf-8f43-5d354b222992"
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

GetDevices

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/GetDevices
This action returns information about some or all of the devices that are connected to the network or have been connected to it at some time in the past. The caller can optionally specify the revision number that was returned from a previous call, in order to query for changes that have occurred since that call.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
deviceIDs UUID[] yes An optional list of device IDs. If this value is specified, information will be returned only for those devices whose IDs appear in the list. If this value is not specified, the returned list of devices will not be filtered by device ID. Note that if an empty array is specified for this value, the returned list of devices will always be empty; in this case, the action serves only to query the most recent revision number.
sinceRevision int yes An optional revision number. If this value is specified, information will be returned only for devices that have been added, changed, or deleted since the specified revision number. If this value is not specified, the returned list of devices will not be filtered by revision number.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
revision int no The revision number corresponding to the most recent change to the device list data. Clients can use this revision number to detect whether the device's data has changed since a point in the past. Once the revision number reaches 2147483647, the next change to the device list will cause the revision number and the last revision number of every device to be reset to 0. This data is not persisted across reboots of the service's host device; after a reboot, the revision number of every device is 0.
devices Device[] no The list of devices, if any, that satisfy the specified filter criteria.
deletedDeviceIDs UUID[] yes A list of the unique IDs of devices that were deleted since the revision specified by the sinceRevision input parameter. If the sinceRevision parameter was not specified, this value is not present in the output. This data is not persisted across reboots of the service's host device.
ErrorInfo string yes Information about an error that occured while retrieving device information. This value will exist and only if result is ErrorDeviceDBFailure.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/GetDevicesResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorDeviceDBFailure A failure occurred while retrieving information from the device database.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/GetDevices"

{
  "deviceIDs": [
    "c23de4d6-15d0-40bf-8f43-5d354b222992"
  ],
  "sinceRevision": 71275
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "revision": 71276,
    "devices": [
      {
        "deviceID": "ce2446ba-5f89-43eb-a2bb-6991a1e5fccb",
        "lastChangeRevision": 71276,
        "model": {
          "deviceType": "Computer",
          "manufacturer": "Linksys, Inc.",
          "modelNumber": "EX9000",
          "hardwareVersion": "1.2.0003",
          "description": "Linksys EX9000 Example Device"
        },
        "unit": {
          "serialNumber": "XXXX-XXXXXXX-12345",
          "firmwareVersion": "3.4.0005",
          "firmwareDate": "2011-07-12T00:00:00Z",
          "operatingSystem": "Windows"
        },
        "isAuthority": true,
        "friendlyName": "Linksys EX9000",
        "knownMACAddresses": [
          "00:22:5F:A1:73:C1"
        ],
        "connections": [
          {
            "macAddress": "00:34:C2:4F:B1:72",
            "ipAddress": "192.168.1.105",
            "ipv6Address": "FE80:0000:0000:0000:0218:FEFF:FE6C:8FF1"
          }
        ],
        "properties": [
          {
            "name": "override:device-name",
            "value": "Jack's Awesome EX9000"
          }
        ],
        "maxAllowedProperties": 123
      }
    ],
    "deletedDeviceIDs": [
      "c23de4d6-15d0-40bf-8f43-5d354b222992"
    ],
    "ErrorInfo": "Payload exceeded maximum size"
  }
}

GetDevices3

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/GetDevices3
This action returns information about some or all of the devices that are connected to the network or have been connected to it at some time in the past. The caller can optionally specify the revision number that was returned from a previous call, in order to query for changes that have occurred since that call.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
deviceIDs UUID[] yes An optional list of device IDs. If this value is specified, information will be returned only for those devices whose IDs appear in the list. If this value is not specified, the returned list of devices will not be filtered by device ID. Note that if an empty array is specified for this value, the returned list of devices will always be empty; in this case, the action serves only to query the most recent revision number.
sinceRevision int yes An optional revision number. If this value is specified, information will be returned only for devices that have been added, changed, or deleted since the specified revision number. If this value is not specified, the returned list of devices will not be filtered by revision number.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
revision int no The revision number corresponding to the most recent change to the device list data. Clients can use this revision number to detect whether the device's data has changed since a point in the past. Once the revision number reaches 2147483647, the next change to the device list will cause the revision number and the last revision number of every device to be reset to 0. This data is not persisted across reboots of the service's host device; after a reboot, the revision number of every device is 0.
devices Device2[] no The list of devices, if any, that satisfy the specified filter criteria.
deletedDeviceIDs UUID[] yes A list of the unique IDs of devices that were deleted since the revision specified by the sinceRevision input parameter. If the sinceRevision parameter was not specified, this value is not present in the output. This data is not persisted across reboots of the service's host device.
ErrorInfo string yes Information about an error that occured while retrieving device information. This value will exist and only if result is ErrorDeviceDBFailure.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/GetDevices3Result
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorDeviceDBFailure A failure occurred while retrieving information from the device database.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/GetDevices3"

{
  "deviceIDs": [
    "c23de4d6-15d0-40bf-8f43-5d354b222992"
  ],
  "sinceRevision": 71275
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "revision": 71276,
    "devices": [
      {
        "deviceID": "ce2446ba-5f89-43eb-a2bb-6991a1e5fccb",
        "lastChangeRevision": 71276,
        "model": {
          "deviceType": "Computer",
          "manufacturer": "Linksys, Inc.",
          "modelNumber": "EX9000",
          "hardwareVersion": "1.2.0003",
          "description": "Linksys EX9000 Example Device"
        },
        "unit": {
          "serialNumber": "XXXX-XXXXXXX-12345",
          "firmwareVersion": "3.4.0005",
          "firmwareDate": "2011-07-12T00:00:00Z",
          "operatingSystem": "Windows"
        },
        "isAuthority": true,
        "nodeType": "Master",
        "isHomeKitSupported": true,
        "friendlyName": "Linksys EX9000",
        "knownInterfaces": [
          {
            "macAddress": "00:34:C2:4F:B1:72",
            "interfaceType": "Wired",
            "band": "2.4GHz"
          }
        ],
        "connections": [
          {
            "macAddress": "00:34:C2:4F:B1:72",
            "ipAddress": "192.168.1.105",
            "ipv6Address": "FE80:0000:0000:0000:0218:FEFF:FE6C:8FF1",
            "parentDeviceID": "03d2bd9f-015d-4a7b-92ac-0c17ef5b4548",
            "isGuest": false
          }
        ],
        "properties": [
          {
            "name": "override:device-name",
            "value": "Jack's Awesome EX9000"
          }
        ],
        "maxAllowedProperties": 123
      }
    ],
    "deletedDeviceIDs": [
      "c23de4d6-15d0-40bf-8f43-5d354b222992"
    ],
    "ErrorInfo": "Payload exceeded maximum size"
  }
}

GetLocalDevice

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/GetLocalDevice
This action returns the ID for the local device.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
deviceID UUID no
ErrorInfo string yes Information about an error that occured while retrieving device information. This value will exist and only if result is ErrorDeviceDBFailure.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/GetLocalDeviceResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorDeviceDBFailure A failure occurred while retrieving information from the device database.
ErrorUnknownDevice The device does not match any known device.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/GetLocalDevice"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "deviceID": "7e04d3bb-8789-4d6b-b8d1-d9b070dfe24e",
    "ErrorInfo": "Payload exceeded maximum size"
  }
}

SetDeviceProperties

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/SetDeviceProperties
This action creates or modifies custom device properties.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
deviceID UUID no The unique ID of the device whose properties should be modified.
propertiesToRemove string[] yes A list of names of the properties, if any, that should be removed. This list is evaluated before the list of properties to modify.
propertiesToModify Property[] yes A list of name-value pairs of the properties, if any, that should be created or whose values should be modified. The number of properties that can be stored is guaranteed to be at least 16 per device, and may be more. If duplicate property names are specified, the last value in the list wins.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/SetDevicePropertiesResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorInvalidPropertyName One or more of the specified property names was invalid.
ErrorPropertyValueTooLong One or more of the specified property values is too long.
ErrorTooManyProperties The specified properties cannot be created because the number of properties would exceed the maximum allowed for the device.
ErrorUnknownDevice The specified device ID does not match any known device.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/SetDeviceProperties"

{
  "deviceID": "c23de4d6-15d0-40bf-8f43-5d354b222992",
  "propertiesToRemove": [
    "example string"
  ],
  "propertiesToModify": [
    {
      "name": "override:device-name",
      "value": "Jack's Awesome EX9000"
    }
  ]
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

Structures

Device

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/Device
Information about a physical device that is connected to the network or has been connected to it at some time in the past.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
deviceID UUID no The unique ID associated with the device. The device list service generates this value the first time it discovers the device on the network. The same device will have different device IDs on different networks, since this value is specific to a particular instance of the device list service.
lastChangeRevision int no The revision number of the most recent change that was made to this device's data. Clients can use the revision number to decide whether or not they need to refresh their cached information of the device. This data is notpersisted across reboots of the service's host device.
model ModelInfo no Information about the device model and version.
unit UnitInfo no Information about this particular instance of the device.
isAuthority bool no Whether the device is the authority on the local network.
friendlyName string yes A "friendly" name for the device, as determined by the service's internal identification mechanism. This value may change when the service discovers new information about the device. This value is not modifiable by clients. Clients that want to override this name should store an override value in a property and implement business logic to check for that property before falling back to the friendly name. This value will not be present if the service is unable to determine a suitable friendly name for the device.
knownMACAddresses MACAddress[] no A list of MAC addresses that are known to belong to the device's network adapters. Since a single physical device may have multiple network adapters, a device may appear as multiple devices in the device list. If the service is able to detect that the two "devices" are in fact the same physical device, it may automatically merge the device data. Otherwise, clients can invoke the MergeDevices action in order to manually trigger a merge operation.
connections Layer3Connection[] no A list of the device's upstream connections to the network. If the device is currently offline, the list will be empty. If the device is online, the list will usually contain one item, since it is very rare for a device to be simultaneously connected to the same network through multiple network adapters.
properties Property[] no A list of custom properties associated with the device.
maxAllowedProperties int no The maximum number of properties that can be associated with the device at one time.

Device2

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/Device2
Information about a physical device that is connected to the network or has been connected to it at some time in the past.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
deviceID UUID no The unique ID associated with the device. The device list service generates this value the first time it discovers the device on the network. The same device will have different device IDs on different networks, since this value is specific to a particular instance of the device list service.
lastChangeRevision int no The revision number of the most recent change that was made to this device's data. Clients can use the revision number to decide whether or not they need to refresh their cached information of the device. This data is notpersisted across reboots of the service's host device.
model ModelInfo no Information about the device model and version.
unit UnitInfo no Information about this particular instance of the device.
isAuthority bool no Whether the device is the authority on the local network.
nodeType NodeType yes Information about the device's role in the Node network. This value will be present ONLY if the device is a Node device AND it is part the Node network.
isHomeKitSupported bool yes Whether the HomeKit feature is supported on the Node. This value will be present ONLY if the device is a Node device AND it is part the Node network.
friendlyName string yes A "friendly" name for the device, as determined by the service's internal identification mechanism. This value may change when the service discovers new information about the device. This value is not modifiable by clients. Clients that want to override this name should store an override value in a property and implement business logic to check for that property before falling back to the friendly name. This value will not be present if the service is unable to determine a suitable friendly name for the device.
knownInterfaces KnownInterface[] no A list of interfaces that are known to belong to the device's network adapters. Since a single physical device may have multiple network adapters, a device may appear as multiple devices in the device list. If the service is able to detect that the two "devices" are in fact the same physical device, it may automatically merge the device data. Otherwise, clients can invoke the MergeDevices action in order to manually trigger a merge operation.
connections Layer3Connection2[] no A list of the device's upstream connections to the network. If the device is currently offline, the list will be empty. If the device is online, the list will usually contain one item, since it is very rare for a device to be simultaneously connected to the same network through multiple network adapters.
properties Property[] no A list of custom properties associated with the device.
maxAllowedProperties int no The maximum number of properties that can be associated with the device at one time.

KnownInterface

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/KnownInterface
Information of a known interface.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
macAddress MACAddress no The MAC address of the interface.
interfaceType InterfaceType no The type of the interface.
band WirelessBand yes The wireless band that the interface is currently connected to. This value exists only when the interfaceType is Wireless and it's online.

Layer3Connection

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/Layer3Connection
A layer-3 connection between a device and its upstream network infrastructure device. At least one of the IP address values will be set.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
macAddress MACAddress no The MAC address of the connected network adapter on the device.
ipAddress IPAddress yes The IPv4 address of the device's connection.
ipv6Address IPv6Address yes The IPv6 address of the device's connection.

Layer3Connection2

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/Layer3Connection2
A layer-3 connection between a device and its upstream network infrastructure device. At least one of the IP address values will be set.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
macAddress MACAddress no The MAC address of the connected network adapter on the device.
ipAddress IPAddress yes The IPv4 address of the device's connection.
ipv6Address IPv6Address yes The IPv6 address of the device's connection.
parentDeviceID UUID yes The UUID of the upstream infrastructure device to which the interface is connected to. This value only exists if the upstream infrastructure device is a Node device.
isGuest bool yes Indicates whether the interface is connected to the guest network. This value will be set to true if the interface is on the guest network. If it is set to false or if it doesn't exist, please consider the interface to be on the main network.

ModelInfo

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/ModelInfo
Information about a particular model of a product. This information does not contain any information specific to a particular instance of a device.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
deviceType string no The category of the device. This value is designed to be used as a primary key for web services or other APIs that look up or record information about particular device models; it is not intended to be displayed to end users.
The list of values currently in use:
Computer A generic computer
Camera A network-enabled camera
Phone A cell (mobile) phone
GameConsole A video game console, such as an XBOX
Printer A network-attached printer
MediaPlayer A network-attached media player, both audio and video, such as a TiVo or Sonos
Storage A network-attached storage device
Printer A network-attached printer
Infrastructure A network infrastructure device, such as a router, wireless access point, bridge, etc
Mobile A small portable device with Wi-Fi capability, such as an iPod touch.
Tablet A tablet, such as an iPad or Samsung Galaxy Tab
WeMoSocket WeMo Socket
WeMoSensor WeMo Sensor
WeMoInsight WeMo Insight
WeMoNetCam WeMo Netcam
WeMoLightSwitch WeMo Light Switch
WeMoCrockpot Crock-Pot Smart Slow Cooker
WeMoPetfeeder WeMo Pet Feeder
WeMoBaby WeMo Baby
WeMoSmart WeMo Smart
WeMoCoffeeMaker Mr. Coffee Smart Optimal Brew Coffeemaker
WeMoHeaterA Holmes Smart Console Heaters
WeMoHeaterB Holmes Smart Console Heaters
WeMoHumidifer Holmes Smart Whole House Console Humidifier
WeMoAirPurifier Holmes True HEPA Smart Air Purifier
WeMoBridge WeMo Connected LED's Bridge
WeMoMaker WeMo Garage Door Maker
DigitalAssistant Amazon Echo
GameDevice A portable gaming device, such as Nintendo 3DS or PS Vita
Wearable A wearable device, such as Apple Watch
DeviceHub A hub for other devices, such as Logitech HarmonyHub or Sonos Bridge
The empty string indicates the category of the device is unknown.
manufacturer string yes The manufacturer of the device. If this value is not present, the manufacturer of the device is unknown.
modelNumber string yes The model number of the device. If this value is not present, the model number of the device is unknown.
hardwareVersion string yes The hardware version of the device. If this value is not present, the hardware version of the device is unknown.
description string yes A brief description of the device. If this value is not present, the device description is unknown.

Property

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/Property
A property name-value pair.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
name string no The name of the property. Property names must be between 1 and 31 characters long, can only contain characters in the set { A-Z, a-z, 0-9, -, _, : }, and can only begin with an uppercase or lowercase letter.
value string no The value of the property, expressed as a string. Property values can be between 0 and 255 characters long, and can contain any characters except null.

UnitInfo

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/UnitInfo
Information about a particular instance of a device.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
serialNumber string yes The serial number of the device. If this value is not present, the serial number of the device is unknown.
firmwareVersion string yes The version number of the device's firmware. If this value is not present, the firmware version of the device is unknown.
firmwareDate DateTime yes The date and time associated with the device's firmware. If this value is not present, the firmware date of the device is unknown.
operatingSystem string yes The operating system running on the device.

Enumerations

InterfaceType

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/InterfaceType
This service exposes information about physical devices that are connected to the network or have been connected to it at some time in the past. The service uses a change revision system to allow clients to perform very efficient lightweight polling to detect when information about one or more devices has changed. Possible interface types.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
Wired The interface type is wired.
Wireless The interface type is wireless.
Unknown The interface type is unknown.

NodeType

http://linksys.com/jnap/devicelist/NodeType
Possible node infrastructure types.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
Master The node is the master.
Slave The node is a slave.

WirelessBand

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WirelessBand
This service provides access to properties and settings of the 802.11 wireless access point. Wireless frequency bands.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
2.4GHz The 2.4GHz frequency band.
5GHz The 5GHz frequency band.
6GHz The 6GHz frequency band.
